   integer :: a1, a2, min_val, i

   ! Read input

   read(*, '(A)') s1

   ! First step: check for A and B

   hasA = .false.

   hasB = .false.

   do i = 1, len_trim(s1)

      if (s1(i:i) == 'A') hasA = .true.

      if (s1(i:i) == 'B') hasB = .true.

   end do

   if (hasA .and. hasB) then

      s2 = 'Yes'

   else

      s2 = 'No'

   end if

   ! Second step: process s2 to get s3

   last_char = s2(len_trim(s2):len_trim(s2))

   lower_char = char(ichar(last_char) + 32)  ! Convert to lowercase

   if (lower_char == 'a' .or. lower_char == 'e' .or. lower_char == 'i' .or. &

       lower_char == 'o' .or. lower_char == 'u' .or. lower_char == 'y') then

      s3 = 'YES'

   else

      s3 = 'NO'

   end if

   ! Third step: process s3

   a = s3

   b = s3

   a1 = 0

   do i = 2, len_trim(a)

      if (a(i:i) == a(i-1:i-1)) then

          if (a(i:i) == '1') then

              a(i:i) = '0'

          else

              a(i:i) = '1'

          end if

          a1 = a1 + 1

      end if

   end do

   a2 = 0

   do i = len_trim(b), 2, -1

      if (b(i:i) == b(i-1:i-1)) then

          if (b(i-1:i-1) == '1') then

              b(i-1:i-1) = '0'

          else

              b(i-1:i-1) = '1'

          end if

          a2 = a2 + 1

      end if

   end do

   min_val = min(a1, a2)

   ! Output the result

   print *, min_val

end program main
